2004 - 120: WHY MARRIAGE MATTERS America, Equality, and Gay People's Right to Marry. By Evan Wolfson. 242 pp. Simon & Schuster. $22.
2004 - 132: Oregon's most populous county will begin issuing marriage licenses to same-sex couples today, a county commissioner said last night.
2004 - 151: The Massachusetts legislature on Monday approved a state constitutional amendment that would ban gay marriage and create same-sex civil unions instead.
2004 - 179: Justices of the California Supreme Court appeared torn Tuesday about whether to invalidate more than 4,000 marriage licenses issued here to same-sex couples in February and March.
2004 - 182: The map that hangs above Liberty Counsel's weekly planning meeting measures the small firm's national reach, with color-coded tabs marking the status of 33 active cases in 13 states.
2004 - 184: For three weeks, the grand marble staircase at City Hall has been wedding central in San Francisco, with thousands of gay and lesbian couples lining up to be married by city officials.
2004 - 196: Following are excerpts from statements by the Democratic presidential candidates at a debate in New York yesterday, as recorded by The New York Times. A full transcript is at nytimes.com/campaign.
2004 - 208: Cardinal Edward Egan and other senior Roman Catholic clerics traveled to Albany yesterday to meet with Gov. George E. Pataki and top lawmakers to convey their church's staunch opposition to same-sex marriage.
2004 - 209: AS the lovely crescent of sand bordering Boston Harbor known as Carson Beach slowly began filling up on a fine Saturday morning, a lone young black woman, her hair in braids, jogged steadily along the pathway.
2004 - 210: Senator John Kerry did not have anything to do with it, but the decision by Massachusetts' highest court to allow gay marriage evidently looms as a political problem for the Democratic presidential candidate.
